text:
Hey guys Q for you. I’m building a site that has a listing of products, then on the product pages all of the products have tables that need to be displayed giving specs on the products The table structure and values/headers can vary product to product.

I want to make it easy for the marketers to create these tables - and they will need to be responsive.

What route do you think is the best route to go for this?

Custom module that is basically a table builder - they create headings and cells in rows and columns.

OR force them to use a rich text-editor allowing them to use the rich text editor to create the tables but possibly losing some control like which items are headers and stuff like that?
<@U7SL518D6> seems like a good candidate for Hub DB

yea  thought about it, but here’s where that gets complicated. There’d be a HubDB for every table (more than 20 tables) OR one big HubDB that is a mishmash of all of the data for all of the tables. Sounds like a headache either way.

If you're on the beta DM I'd go with a custom module with nested repeaters, one for each row then another repeater for each cell within that row; probably the most flexible way to do it if they're only going to be on those pages.
Then I'd probably agree with Mark on it.

<!here> Hi all. We have some exciting news about HubSpot’s Marketplace and the new Design Manager. We’ve just made a number of HubSpot’s modules available within the Marketplace for you to add to any portal, and develop on top of. Included in the list of available modules is the HTML Module, which you can now add back to any portal that has the new Design Manager.

 In the coming weeks, we’ll allow providers to submit their own custom modules to the marketplace for all HubSpot customers to use. If you’re a Marketplace provider, we’ll be reaching out to describe the new submission requirements and answer any questions you might have on submitting your own modules to the Marketplace. 

Feel free to refer to this blog post for more information 
<https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/now-live-HubSpot-modules-available-in-the-marketplace>
How may rows/ columsn in each table?
I think the most columns that will be in a table is 5 or 6, and the most rows, I’m gonna say 10 to play it safe
unfortunately it varies from product to product and each product can have multiple tables associated with it
For those of us who aren't currently Marketplace Providers, but would like to get on board, how do we find out about the new submission requirements?

Submission requirements sooner rather than later would be ideal, especially for those of us that already have templates in the marketplace that we need/want to update to take advantage of the new features in Design Manager.

Also wondering how everyone else would feel about this: What about including the hubl snippet for each module within the marketplace description of the module.

i.e. for the accordion module include this snippet:
```{% module_block module "unique-id-here" wrapping_html='', per_widget_wrapper_html='', overrideable=true, widget_name='Accordion Toggle', module_id=1883428, label='Accordion Toggle' %}
{% end_module_block %}```
I know there's (obviously) other ways to get at the Hubl for each of these module, but for those of us who are writing HTML templates, it might be nice to be able to skip the clone to file step
So when I go to the marketplace, i dont see them: <https://marketplace.HubSpot.com/products?subType=CUSTOM_MODULE>
also I do have the DM beta
We do not have the modules  live on the public facing <http://marketplace.HubSpot.com|marketplace.HubSpot.com>

you have to use your portal ID here:
<https://app.HubSpot.com/marketplace/{{PORTALID}}/products?subType=CUSTOM_MODULE>
We are working on it. We will send all current providers an FAQ tomorrow which will provide some detail.
ah i see. Thanks!
<@U54TVT3C1> - If you would like to create an account you can do so here - <https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-marketplace-account>
Oh cool.  Thanks Shawn!
:thumbsup:

Does anyone know if it’s possible to add a privacy policy/checkbox to *all forms*, with a link to the privacy policy right in the description of the form? I can’t figure a way to get a link embedded in the form label without some hacky script.
Did you try putting html in the label?
<@U22PNRAJD> pinned a message to this channel.
